meanings.definition: To substitute one person or thing for another
meanings.sent1: I had to subrogate my friend to help me with the project.
meanings.sent2: She decided to subrogate the old chair with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked me to subrogate the noisy student with a quiet one.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn can subrogate the queen in certain situations.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was able to subrogate the villain's evil plan with a clever strategy.

meanings.definition: To put in the place of another
meanings.sent1: Please subrogate the red cup with the blue one.
meanings.sent2: He subrogated the broken glass with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The magician subrogated the rabbit with a colorful scarf.
meanings.sent4: The temporary worker will subrogate the manager during her absence.
meanings.sent5: The substitute teacher will subrogate the regular teacher for the week.

meanings.definition: To transfer a right or claim to another party
meanings.sent1: The company decided to subrogate the ownership rights to a new investor.
meanings.sent2: He subrogated his parking spot to his colleague for the day.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer subrogated the legal claim to a more experienced attorney.
meanings.sent4: The author subrogated the publishing rights to a different publishing house.
meanings.sent5: The athlete subrogated his sponsorship deal to a charity organization.
